intro: Calpidisca capensis, commonly known as the Cape calpidisca, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features a compact, branching stem with small, blue-green leaves. Its flowers are often yellow or orange, and it blooms during the warmer months.
